title: 1979–80 Serie A
text:
The 1979–80 Serie A season was the 78th edition of <a href="Serie%20A">Serie A</a>, the top-level <a href="association%20football">football</a> competition in <a href="Italy">Italy</a>. The championship was won by <a href="F.C.%20Internazionale%20Milano">Internazionale</a>. <a href="AC%20Milan">AC Milan</a> were relegated for the first time in their history following a match fixing scandal.
Teams.
<a href="Udinese">Udinese</a>, <a href="Cagliari%20Calcio">Cagliari</a> and <a href="Pescara%20Calcio">Pescara</a> had been promoted from <a href="Serie%20B">Serie B</a>.
Events.
Following the creation of the <a href="UEFA%20ranking">UEFA ranking</a>, Italy lost two out of its four places in the UEFA Cup inherited from the Fairs Cup.
Final classification.
